scenarios.label: Baseline / Recommended
scenarios.description: Azure Databricks Premium with VNet injection, jobs cluster ~4×D3_v2 equivalent, 1000 DBU/month, backed by Blob Storage data lake and standard monitoring/security.

resources.notes: Single analytics VNet for Databricks VNet injection and private endpoints. No direct charge but required for architecture.
Azure Databricks Premium workspace with VNet injection enabled. DBU consumption modeled separately via jobs cluster assumptions.

Jobs cluster approximated as 4× Standard_D3_v2 worker nodes under Databricks control. 250 hours/month to roughly align with 1000 DBU/month usage (DBU pricing handled separately by Databricks). Includes ephemeral OS disks (128 GB each) for workers.
Databricks driver node approximated as an additional Standard_D3_v2. Included for more accurate VM cost modeling of the jobs cluster.

Primary Blob-based data lake (can be ADLS Gen2). Assumes 2 TB total, mostly Hot tier for analytics workloads, with some Cool for older data. GRS for durability. Includes moderate egress for downstream consumers.

sku_candidates.product_name: Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 Hierarchical Namespace

resources.notes: Represents Databricks VNet injection and required private endpoints/subnets. No direct SKU; any private endpoint hourly charges and data processing will be modeled by the pricing engine. Quantity 2 approximates workspace and backend PEs.
NAT Gateway for outbound internet access from Databricks subnets. 300 GB/month egress aligned with data lake assumptions.
resources.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

sku_candidates.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

resources.notes: Standard Public IP associated with NAT Gateway for outbound traffic.
Central Log Analytics workspace for Databricks diagnostics, VM metrics, and activity logs. Assumes ~200 GB/month ingestion.
Key Vault for secrets, keys, and Databricks-backed secret scopes. Standard tier with moderate operations.
Recovery Services vault for backup of supporting VMs and configuration (not for Databricks-managed control plane). 250 GB protected data assumed.

resources.notes: Azure Site Recovery for 2 protected instances (e.g., gateway or supporting VMs) to paired region. Databricks control plane is managed by Microsoft and not protected via ASR.

scenarios.label: Cost Optimized
scenarios.description: Databricks Premium with VNet injection, smaller jobs cluster and reduced hours to lower VM and DBU costs, smaller data lake footprint and lighter monitoring.

resources.notes: Same VNet concept as baseline; no direct charge.
Databricks Premium workspace retained for features; cost optimization via smaller cluster and fewer hours (DBU usage ~600 DBU/month).
Smaller jobs cluster: 3× Standard_D2s_v3 workers, 160 hours/month (e.g., business hours only). Reduces VM and DBU consumption.
Driver node downsized to Standard_D2s_v3 with reduced runtime.
Smaller data lake (1 TB) with LRS instead of GRS. More data in Cool tier to reduce storage cost.
resources.meter_name: Hot Data Returned for Query Acceleration, Cool Data Scanned for Query Acceleration

sku_candidates.product_name: Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 Hierarchical Namespace

resources.notes: NAT Gateway with reduced egress aligned to smaller workload.
resources.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

sku_candidates.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

resources.notes: Public IP for NAT Gateway.
Reduced monitoring volume to lower Log Analytics cost while retaining essential observability.
Key Vault retained; slightly fewer operations assumed.
Smaller backup footprint for supporting resources. ASR omitted to reduce cost; DR handled via redeployment.

scenarios.label: High Performance
scenarios.description: Databricks Premium with VNet injection, larger autoscaling jobs cluster and higher DBU usage, bigger GRS data lake and enhanced monitoring for heavy analytics workloads.

resources.notes: Same VNet concept; may use more subnets and private endpoints but no direct VNet charge.
Databricks Premium workspace with higher DBU usage (~2000 DBU/month) for intensive analytics.
High-performance jobs cluster: 6× Standard_D4s_v3 workers, 400 hours/month to represent heavier and more frequent jobs. Suitable for larger ETL and ML workloads.
Larger driver node to handle more concurrent jobs and metadata operations.
Larger GRS data lake (5 TB) with majority in Hot tier for frequent analytics. Higher egress and operations for heavy workloads.

resources.notes: Public IP for NAT Gateway in high-performance scenario.

More secrets/keys and higher operation count for complex pipelines and integrations.
Larger backup footprint for supporting resources and configurations.
